Name: Equals
Meaning: equal to

Name: Identically Equals
Meaning: identically equal to

Name: Not Equals
Meaning: not equal to

Name: Approximately Equals
Meaning: approximately equal to

Name: Tilde
Meaning: of same order as (used in comparisons of infinitesimals or infinites) < less than... 'a less than b' is written as a < b (or, equivalently, b > a) ≤ less than or equal to...a less than or equal to b is written as a≤b
Translation: is of the same order as

Name: Much Less Than
Meaning: much less than... a much less than b is written as a ≪ b

Name: Greater Than
Meaning: greater than... a greater than b is written as a > b (or, equivalently, b < a) ≥ greater than or equal to... a greater than or equal to b is written as a ≥ b

Name: Much Greater Than
Meaning: much greater than... a much greater than b is written as a ≫ b

Name: Plus
Meaning: plus sign... the sum of numbers a and b is denoted by a + b and has the property a+b=b+a

Name: Minus
Meaning: minus sign... the difference of numbers a and b is denoted by a – b

Name: Product
Meaning: multiplication sign... the product of numbers a and b is denoted by either ab or a ⋅ b (sometimes a × b) and has the property ab = ba... the inner product of vectors a and b is denoted by a ⋅ b
Translation: multiplied by (or if vectors, the inner product of)

Name: Product
Meaning: multiplication sign... the product of numbers a and b is sometimes denoted by a × b... the cross-product of vectors a and b is denoted by a × b

Name: Ratio
Meaning: division sign... the ratio of numbers a and b is denoted by a : b or a/b

Name: Factorial
Translation: factorial (the product of this number and all integers below it)

Name: Double Factorial
Translation: double factorial (product of this number and all even numbers below it)

Name: Percent
Meaning: percent sign... 1% is one hundredth of the entire quantity
Translation: percent (1% is one hundreth of the entire quantity)

Name: Infinity
Meaning: infinity
Translation: a number greater than any assignable quantity or countable number

Name: Arrow
Meaning: tends (infinitely approaches) to... x → a means that x tends to a

Name: Right Double Arrow
Meaning: implies... consequently

Name: Left Right Double Arrow
Meaning: is equivalent to(if and only if...)

Name: Upside Down A
Meaning: for all, for any

Name: Existential Qualifier
Meaning: there exists

Name: Epsilon
Meaning: 􏰁􏰁belongs to... a ∈ A means that a is an element of the set A

Name: Not An Element Of
Meaning: does not belong to... a ∉􏰂 A means that a is not an element of the set A

Name: Union
Meaning: union (Boolean addition)... A ∪ B stands for the union of sets A and B

Name: Intersection
Meaning: intersection (Boolean multiplication)... A ∩ B stands for the intersection (common part) of sets A and B

Name: Inclusion
Meaning: inclusion... A ⊂ B means that the set A is part of the set B

Name: Non-Strict Inclusion
Meaning: nonstrict inclusion... A ⊆ B means that the set A is part of the set B or coincides with B
Translation: is a subset of (and may or may not equal)

Name: Empty Set
Meaning: empty set

Meaning: sum, <Insert Picture> ak = a1 + a2 + ... + an
Translation: evaluate the expression ($v4) ($v2)-($v1) times by starting at ($v3)  = ($v1), up until ($v3) = ($v2) , and summing the accumulated result each time.

Name: Product Operator
Meaning: product, <Insert Picture> ak = a1 ⋅ a2 ⋅ ... ⋅ an
Translation: evaluate the expression ($v4) ($v2)-($v1) times by starting at ($v3)  = ($v1), up until ($v3) = ($v2) , and multiplying the accumulated result each time.

Name: Partial Derivative
Meaning: symbol used to denote partial derivatives and differential operators... ∂x is the operator of differentiation with respect to x

Name: Nabla
Meaning: vector differential operator 'nabla'... ∇a is the gradient of a scalar a

Name: Integral
Meaning: integral... <insert Picture> f(x) dx is the integral of a function f(x) over the interval [a, b]

Name: Contour Integral
Meaning: contour integral (denotes an integral over a closed contour)

Name: Perpindicular
Meaning: perpendicular

Name: Parallel
Meaning: parallel

Name: Argument
Meaning: argument of a complex number z = x + iy... by definition, tan(Arg z) = y/x

Name: Principle Argument
Meaning: principal value of Arg z... by definition, arg z = Arg z, where –π < Arg z ≤ π
Translation: the principal value of the argument of complex number ($v1)

Name: Square Root
Meaning: square root of a number a, defined by the property (√a )2 = a

Name: Nth Root
Meaning: nth root of a number a(n=2, 3, …,a≥0),defined by the property(n√ a)n=a

Name: Vector
Meaning: vector, a = {a1 , a2 , a3 }, where a1 , a2 , a3 are the vector components

Name: Modulus of Vector
Meaning: a⋅a modulus of a vector a, |a| = √ <insert picture here>

Name: Inner Product
Meaning: inner product of vectors a and b, denoted also by (a ⋅ b). Also known as the ‘dot product’.
Translation: multiply the corresponding co-ordinates of vectors ($v1) and ($v2) and add up their products to produce a total.

Name: Cross Product
Meaning: cross-product of vectors a and b. Also known as ‘cartesian product’.
Translation: multiply vectors ($v1) and ($v2) by the sine of the angle (and the unit vector at right angles) between them.

Name: Triple Vector Product
Meaning: triple product of vectors a, b, c. Also known as mixed product, box product, or triple scalar product.

Name: Open Interval
Meaning: interval (open interval) a < x < b
Translation: within the interval ranging from ($v1) to ($v2), where ($v1) and ($v2) are not included

Name: Half Open Interval 1

Name: Half Open Interval 2
Meaning: half-open interval a ≤ x < b

Name: Closed Interval
Meaning: interval (closed interval) a ≤ x ≤ b
Translation: within the interval ranging from ($v1) to ($v2), where ($v1) and ($v2) are both included

Meaning: arccotangent, the inverse function of cotangent: cot(arccot x) = x

Name: Arctangent Function
Meaning: arctangent, the inverse function of tangent: tan(arctan x) = x
